late.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: arriving, happening, or done after the time that was expected, agreed, or arranged
late.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The train was even later than usual.
We apologize for the late departure of flight AZ709.
There are penalties if loan repayments are late.
We’ve never been late with the rent.
late.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to refer to the part near the end of a period of time
late.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: By late afternoon, she had done 10 drawings.
late.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: happening or done after the usual or normal time
late.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The harvest was late this year because of the rain.
She looked tired – too many late nights (=nights when she went to bed after the normal time).
late.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: near the end of a day
late.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: It’s late – I’d better go home.
late.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with late
late.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You are late for work, school, a meeting etc
I was late for my appointment
late.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: You are late for your train, bus, plane etc
Hurry up or you’ll be late for your train!
late.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: You are late with something that you have to produce, for example your work or the rent
He was always late with his homework
late.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3]: They were late paying the rent
late.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4]: that someone is late in doing something
They were late in paying the rent
late.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: late
arriving or happening after the time that was expected or arranged
Sorry I’m late.
The bus was late.
Spring seems to be very late this year.
not on time
not arriving or doing something at the time that was expected or arranged
He never hands his homework in on time.
If we don’t leave on time, we’ll miss the flight.
overdue
not done or happening by the expected time – used especially about payments that are late or library books that should have been returned
Your rent is three weeks overdue.
I had to pay a £3 fine on some overdue library books.
be behind with something
to be late in doing something that you have to do
I can’t come out because I’m behind with my English essay.
be held up
to be made late for a meeting, appointment etc by something that happens, especially by bad traffic
I was held up by a traffic jam.
be delayed
to be prevented from arriving, leaving, or happening at the expected time – often used about public transport
The flight was delayed by bad weather.
belated
given or done late – used especially about something that someone has forgotten or failed to do
a belated birthday card
I’m still hoping for a belated apology from him.
tardy
arriving or happening late
a habitually tardy person
a tardy decision
be in arrears
to have not made one or more regular payments at the time when you should
One in eight mortgage payers are in arrears.
late.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The stores are open later on Thursdays.
Ellen has to work late tonight.
late.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: after the arranged or expected time
late.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The bus came ten minutes late.
late.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: near to the end of a period of time or an event
late.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: It was not a place to walk in late at night.
The wedding took place late in May.
